qas.question: How are the total numbers of seats allocated to parties?

answers.text: proportionally to the number of votes received
proportionally to the number of votes received
proportionally to the number of votes received in the second vote of the ballot using the d'Hondt method

qas.question: What method is used for tallying votes in the second vote of the ballot?
The party awarded a seat is the one with the highest what?
What set is a seat added to after being allocated?
How is the process of allocating seats repeated until all available seats have been determined?
The party with the lowest quotient is awarded what?
What is subtracted to its constituency seats?
What method is used in tallying votes in the first vote of the ballot?
The first vote of the ballot uses what method to tally the votes?

context: The total number of seats in the Parliament are allocated to parties <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>proportionally to the number of votes received<a0_1/><a0_0/> in the second vote of the ballot using <a1_0><a1_2><b7_0><b8_0>the <a1_1>d'Hondt<a1_1/> method<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_2/><a1_0/><a0_2/>. For example, to determine who is awarded the first list seat, the number of list votes cast for each party is divided by one plus the number of seats the party won in the region (at this point just constituency seats). The party with the highest <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>quotient<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> is awarded <b5_0><b6_0>the seat<b6_0/><b5_0/>, which is then added to its <a3_0><a3_1>constituency<a3_1/> seats<a3_0/> in allocating the <a3_2>second<a3_2/> seat. This is repeated <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>iteratively<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> until all available list seats are allocated.
